intro: Sebastiania hispida var. leucoblepharis, commonly known as the white-eyed sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil, and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and distinctive, waxy leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a common reproductive strategy among members of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant's ornamental value is enhanced by its unique foliage and subtle floral display.
